Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, modern”
Reviews.Author: Virginia P
Reviews.Content: Fairly modest accommodation, small but comfortable room, modern bathroom. The hotel is in a good location for the subway and city bus lines, between the Born/Barri Gotic areas and Sagrada Familia - easy walking to those areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff.. But 3* not 4*”
Reviews.Author: djw319
Reviews.Content: Just returned, the location was good. It was overpriced, the rooms were comfortable but very basic. It was no more splendid than an ibis. The staff were good and so was the shower! I would not stay there again given the competition.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but near the triangle”
Reviews.Author: sarabravery
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel four nights during august. The city was crowded. It looked like every single italian was in vacation in Barcelona at the same time. Despite the caos, I enjoed the Ayre Hotel Caspe. The cool design makes it quite posh and although collocated in a peaceful neighbourhood (there is a fine pastry shop just across the street and two or three mini markets) you can reach the triangle in 10 minutes by foot. It is also near enough to the underground and that allows you to visit the whole city saving a lot of time. I totally recommend Barcelona because you can't leave this city without a smile on your face I also recommend this hotel, it's the best quality/price ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Karonov85
Reviews.Content: Very modern hoel. Close to metro station and to Sagrada Familia. Very friendly staff and very comfy room.

Reviews.Title: “rooms not up to spec for a 4 star hotel; location excellent”
Reviews.Author: hannrich
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and had to move room 3 times because things were not working in each romm offered : 1) WIFI, 2) heating 3) window jammed broken, 4) fridge broken and making loud noise. There was also some mold in each of the showers in the rooms. The staff were quite accommodating and offered us a new room for every night. The location is excellent with lots of sight seeing and restaurants within walking distance. The Himalyian restaurant directly across from the Hotel is excellent if you like authenic indidan food.

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds...”
Reviews.Author: Carole1971
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I spent 7 nights in this hotel. We booked via "Lastminutes" and found a very good price. I sent an e-mail before going about a non-smoking room and twin beds, I had an answer, and when w arrived, that's what we found. Our room was at the 7th floor. The people working at the reception were nice and the two girls at the bar where we took most of our breakfasts and some of our dinners were very nice, patients and doing their best even if we didn't really speak spanish (and one of them wasn't really speaking english either !). The room was nice, big enough, nice big bathroom (italian shower AND bath), everything very clean, shampoo and everything everyday. The walls are not very big, but we didn't suffer with the noise at all (except some mornings when the maids began the cleaning of the rooms around). The loctaion was pretty good for us : not very central -and so not noisy, neither crowded in the streets around- but maximum 15 minutes walking from everything (and very close to the metro station "Tetuan"). But the really bad point was the bed : it's a wood board covered with a quite hard mattress.. on with we could feel all the springs ! My friend and I like beds not smooth, but those ones made us wake up with pain in all our -little muscles-. Too bad, because for everything else it has been ok. So if you like very very hard beds, I recommand this hotel. But I hope they'll do something, so I could recommand it for everybody who would like a quite place to sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: ibanda_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with another couple to celebrate his 50th and the 6th anniversary of when I first met my wife. We were very staisfied apart from their room reeking of tobacco smoke. They made a good job of decorating our breakfast table. One tip is to ask at reception for them to mark the position of the hotel on a map since the streets are very similar.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: jamierae
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend this hotel for all travellers, I stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend in February 2012 and couldn't have been happier with the experience, especially given that I paid just €50 per night. Overall my experience was very positive - I would stay here again and I would also recommend the hotel to others. The standard of the room was quite high, featuring both a stand-up shower and a separate shower/bath combo. The entire hotel seemed very modern and clean, while the attitudes of the hotel staff I encountered at check-in and check-out were extremely positive - they were very keen to help in any way they could. I had the impression of a group of people who are very focused on the guests, which is unlike some of my experiences in other hotels in Spain. The hotel location is good if, like me, you don't mind doing some walking. I walked into the Old Town on a couple of occasions, passing the Arc de Triomf - it's around a 20 minute walk. The Sagrada Familia cathedral is only 15 minutes on foot. One tip for anyone interested - there is a Domino's Pizza outlet just round the corner opposite the hotel, 2 minutes walk at the most. Very handy for ordering good pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Tiger824
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ayre Caspe for 8 days over Christmas. The hotel is a great value. It's modern, clean, and reasonably quiet. The staff have all been kind and helpful. It's located in a more residential area, but within easy walking distance to the main sights. The free internet worked well enough in the rooms and very well in the lobby. The bathroom has a tub and shower, which was nice- and unusual in Europe in my experience. It's not a fancy place- more Ikea than the Ritz- but perfectly comfortable with a lovely staff and a reasonable price. I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Rasvan01
Reviews.Content: Modern furnishings, good size for Barcelona, small fridge in the room, air conditioning working fine, good location, close to the subway and 15 minutes walking from downtown. And reasonable priced for Barcelona as well.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: rogerandmarg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2011, and would definitely stay again. The hotel was clean, modern and attractive and lovely and quiet at night. The bedrooms were a really good size, and the bathroom had wet-room shower AND a bath with a shower as well. The staff were all friendly and helpful, even though the extent of our Spanish was by way of a phrase book that we had bought two days previously! The breakfasts were fantastic. Lots of time allowed and plenty of choice for food and drink - even Cava! We were lucky as breakfast was included in our holiday package, but would have cost us 15 euros each otherwise. We ate in the hotel bar on a couple of evenings, and the prices were certainly reasonable. Wine is good value at 2 euros a glass and tastes good as well - not cheap plonk. Coca cola slightly more expensive at 2.50........but don't buy spirits unless you have plenty of money - my G&T cost more than 4 glasses of wine! The location is great as well, a shortish walk to the Sagrada Familia (our walk ended up longer as we got lost, having no sense of direction). Also walkable to the Ramblas and the lovely park which leads to the Barcelona Zoo. All in all a place to return to to.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend”
Reviews.Author: jlwatkinson
Reviews.Content: A pleasant modern hotel with uncluttered attractive bedrooms. The room we had was nice and quiet and the breakfasts good. One draw back was the double bed in adapted bedrooms - surely twin would have been more flexible to everyones needs? The adapted bathroom was well thought out. The staff were helpful and friendly and drinks prices were acceptable. Although I though the rooms were attractive I have only marked it 3 instead of 5 because of the problem with the adapted room.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Kazana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in september 2011, the staff was very friendly, answering all our questions with a smile. The room was plenty big with 2 large beds (although a single bed would have been nicer). Both a shower and a (small) bath were available in the bathroom. Breakfast was quite expensive: 15€ per person, per day. Although it would be discounted to 12€ if we'd order the breakfast for the entire stay during check-in. Instead we looked for a nice local place to have breakfast (exit the hotel to the right and walk 4 or 5 blocks). The biggest downside was with our room: it was located pretty close to the lobby which meant that a couple of days we were awoken because a large group of people had gathered there before going to town. This hotel was located outside the busy tourist center, which means it was pretty quiet in the evenings. It's also pretty close to the Tetuán subway station; if you're in shape, you can make the trip from the airport using the train and the subway, if not a taxi ride is the best way to go (it costs around 35€).

Reviews.Title: “Decent and clean, but not super”
Reviews.Author: jwauters
Reviews.Content: Room: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and booked 2 rooms. A regular double room and a room for 3 persons, which was the same room with an extra smaller bed. The room was big enough and had a very clean and spateous bathroom! The airco was great and silent and was very welcome when it is 31 degrees Celsius in mid septembre. Also the hotel staff was very friendly and offers to help you at all times. Food: Breakfast was rather poor: a lot of empty plates, not always enough cups for coffee and only some pastries to choose from. If you are looking for restaurants or pubs, you better look for another place as there is nothing much here. Location: The location is also not ideal, but okay. A 5 minute walk takes you to the Metro station at Plaça Tetuan, from where you can easily discover the city for very little money! A 10 trip ticket was only 8 euro and metro trains come by every 3 minutes! The blocks nearby are not very charming to walk through, but if you want, you can still walk by foot to the nearby hotspots (Eg. Sagrada Familia = 30min walk). We liked this hotel, and if the breakfast would have been better, it would deserve 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good, with a few not-goods”
Reviews.Author: experimentaltraveler
Reviews.Content: We arranged a package including air and hotel. The hotel was very welcoming with a modern lobby. The location is quite good, safe and within access of many areas to shop and roam. The room was comfortable, but after the second night, we noticed bug bites. Now, as a nurse, I recognize that 2-3 bites in rows usually means bed bugs. I went to the front desk and the desk clerk insisted that they were mosquito bites. It took another day (which was our last in Barcelona) before getting a new room. We checked the mattresses out very well and had a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience at the Caspe in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, 20-year old son and myself) spent 5 nights in mid-August at the Caspe. It is a modern and solid 4-star hotel. We were given a triple-room, facing a quiet yet sunny back patio. The space was very adequate (not enormous, but not tiny a la London, either) for the three of us. The bathroom was quite modern with separate tub and glass-enclosed shower (the water pressure in the shower was memorable!), all beds were quite solid (as we like them, although some people could find them too hard), and the in-room safe deposit box could comfortably accommodate a laptop computer. Very clean, rooms were serviced satisfactorily every day. The desk staff were very correct and corteous without becoming annoyingly obsequious. Although the reception desk seemed to always have custormers, they nevertheless took the time to give us indications to restaurants, to move around town, to secure a taxi back to the airport, all without any attitude. Our rate did not include breakfast (at about Euro 10 or 12 per person, it did not look appetizing....) yet there are bars and cafés (one run by a Chinese family right accross the street) when you can be like the locals and have your café con leche plus croissant for about 2 to 3 euros. As to the "negatives" (if you must insist on a "balanced" view....): I cannot think of its location as a negative, although some people insist on being on top of the action and this hotel certainly is not. It is located 2 to 3 blocks away from the Tetuan metro station and the main buses. Unless you like 30 minute walks, you will need to take public transportation from the hotel to get to the main Barcelona areas of attraction (Passeig de Gracia, Ramblas, Born, Barceloneta, Raval, Sagrada Familia) as well as the better restaurants. Yet, we were very happy every night to come back to the quiet of our hotel and not be in a room deep in the noise of the above areas. The only item that needs improvement is the wi-fi. It is offered, it is free, but uneven and weak. The hotel provides its guests, on a first-come first-served basis, of ethernet cables to get a hardwire connection in your room, and then everything is fine, albeit somewhat slow from what it is expected from a hard-wired connection. Make sure to inquire about your cable early in the morning, when departing guests return theirs. Nevertheless, a note of caution here: there are two telephone sockets in the room where you can plug the ethernet cable. You should use the even numbered socket for Internet. The odd number socket is for telephony and, like another reviewer found out the hard way, could lead to extra charges. In summary, the Ayre Caspe is a very good all around hotel, a good value for the money, and I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay that is off the tourist path”
Reviews.Author: Nathan1750
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here: ten days total, staff was somewhat helpful (weakest part of the hotel), room was HUGE and comfortable and very clean, cleaning staff excellent, breakfast was average, bartender was very good with wine selections of Spain, location was great- three blocks from the bus stop to the beacses, three blocks from Sagrada Familia (best site in Barcelona!) six blocks from Arc de triumph, and nine blocks from the major tourist area (La Rambla), quiet area of town with some small eating joints but no shopping. Would definitely stay here again. Booked thru Orbitz so the room was paid for before we arrived, highly suggest this process so there is no dispute with the charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to discover Barca”
Reviews.Author: cuzquena
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, a bit out of the centre and (I think) mainly a business-people place. But in quiet times, you can often find a good deal here. At walking distance of the Sagrada Familia and the Arc de Triomphe, so not so far out of the way. Bike rental close to the hotel, great way to discover the city !! Nice breakfast, good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, modern hotel... great service and good location”
Reviews.Author: Louis514
Reviews.Content: We received outstanding service from the entire staff at the hotel during our stay. The manager (Xavier) was especially helpful in giving us recommendations as well as get us in contact with local service providers (guided tours, bike rentals, ...). Our room was clean, comfortable and includes a good wifi connection. The hotel has plenty of shops / restaurants nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: iHEARTfineDINING
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is pretty good. I read some reviews saying it is not in a good part of the City, and while it is located in a relatively quiet area, I never felt unsafe even walking back to the hotel late at night. The hotel is within walking distance to the main tourist attractions. I walked everywhere and never needed to rely on public transport (which was preferable as I did not want to deal with the notorious pickpocketers on the Metro). The room was small but are comfortable. My only complaints about this hotel is that the shower tiles were clearly very old and looked dirty. In addition, I asked reception for an iron to press a shirt (which was quite wrinkled from being in my suitcase) and she said they do not offer this - the only option was to send this to an external cleaner. Given I needed the shirt for that evening, they were going to charge 50% premium for the service but could not guarantee it would be ready in time for when I needed it. Suffice to say I was not impressed by this. Otherwise, decent hotel but nothing special. Would recommend it as a no frills but comfortable option.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location and top value!”
Reviews.Author: NPR35
Reviews.Content: The Ayre Caspe hotel is a quality hotel in a great location in Barcelona. It is under a mile to all the major locations and the staff were generally good. One, Jordi, was really helpful and friendly. One of the others was not as helpful and seemed more occupied with a personal call rather than checking us in. Anyway, the room was nice and clean and the facilities are good although the gym is a but small and the water dispenser did not work. The offer of free water and wifi only applied to water on the first day and the wifi signal was poor. Apart from that everyone was nice and helpful and the room was kept clean throughout our week stay. Overall a good hotel and a pleasant stay. Would stay there again and would recommend particularlyto those on a budget as it is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great hotel, Great people and value”
Reviews.Author: bxbon
Reviews.Content: -main/only problem: Internet was a pain and a hassle despite the promise of wireless access, the system was usually down, and the public machines were slow and difficult. this was a problem for contacting people and checking flight times. - also there were lights that didn't work - otherwise the place is fresh and modern and relatively easy to access. general location was a bit removed from the central parts of the city, but it was fine

Reviews.Title: “Great value for great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic: spotless, very large room, beautiful bathroom with all you need, and an extremely friendly staff. Would certainly recomend for everyone, it is for sure the best price/quality in Barcelona. The location is also great (next to metro), the main hall is a piece of art, and the fares are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just not for us”
Reviews.Author: shimono
Reviews.Content: We checked in on the 4th of June and stayed for six nights. We arrived at around 10am, and a friendly reception lady checked us in. We were greeted by her warmly. As we arrived quite early, so we had to wait for about 40 minutes in the lobby before we could resign to our rooms. The lobby design is very minimalist and feels quite lifeless and uninviting. Nonetheless it was brightened up by the first day’s hotels receptionists. Hotel was clean and superb, but one thing they do not provide is a kettle/flask. It is troublesome if you want to make a hot drink, because you have to call the room service for it. On one of the nights, we had to go down to the cafeteria to fetch the flask of hot water ourselves. The cafeteria was actually quite empty except for one customer, and yet we were told they were busy. We also realized that the electrical switch converter that we brought could not fit into their electrical outlets so we asked the receptionist if they could provide us with one. From our experience other hotels could easily provide a converter for us if we had brought the wrong one. When we asked them, we were quickly given a no answer and our request was treated quite dismissively a bit too fast. We felt there were no genuine attempts to help us out. In the end we had to stake out Barcelona and source for the converter ourselves by combing through the streets of Barcelona. The hotel was situated at a quiet street, so we being two girls there were times we felt worried when we were walking back to the hotel at night so it pays to take precautionary measures. But since the hotel is situated away from the tourist area, so therefore you can sleep in peace at night. The nearest metro would be Tetuan (Purple, L2), followed by Arc de Triomf (Red, L1). Finally, the last day we forgot to bring our second camera, we did not put it in the safe, and the cleaning lady apparently went in to clean the room because we did not put up the ‘do not disturb’ sign, but then when we came back everything is still intact. We felt really thankful that nothing untoward happened given the numerous warning about items that other travelers have lost which they unintentionally left it in their hotels around Barcelona. Overall, our stay was quite okay; we would recommend this hotel but based on personal preference we will look for other hotels if we are going to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice- definately will go back”
Reviews.Author: gabriellepnj
Reviews.Content: After a one night stay at the Ayre Rossellon at another part of Barcelona, we knew we wouldn't be dissapointed. Modern, clean, staff very helpfull, and bearing in mind the standard of the hotel and the surroundings, i was shocked at the value of the drinks, glass of house white wine- 2euro!! Which meant that it was nice to spend time in the hotel and not just as a base for crashing at the end of a long day, 10 minute walk from the hotel is catalonia square, fab for shopping great atmosphere and a huge Hard Rock cafe, which means there is a back-up for people who may not enjoy spanish food, or a break from all the tapas. there is a supermarket next door with the cheapest fruit and wine which is great to save on costs if you want to take a picnic out anywhere. already looking at other ayre hotels to visit next time and after many dissapointing hotels in the past, my faith is restored :) hope u enjoy as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: deder81
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, but in an OK location. We stayed two nights at this property in early April and got a great deal on the price. The rooms are of decent size and the beds are comfortable. There is a refrigerator in the room and it is stocked daily with water (both with and without gas). The bathroom is ample size with both a shower and a tub. There are a few restaurants close to the hotel. We tried a cheap tapas place across the street (next to the coffee shop). It had really cheap food and the quality fit the price. We ate when we were in the tourist areas before we got back to the hotel. I would have given this hotel a 5/5 if it were in a better location. It is approximately 15 minutes walking from Sagrada Familia (absolutely beautiful inside) and about 10 minutes from the Arc de Triumph and its metro station under the same name. We got the T10 pass which worked out great. You can virtually get anywhere in the city with this pass, even the airport . Barcelona is an amazing city and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: flumpypup
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Barcelona and I stayed at the Hotel Ayre Caspe. The hotel was all you could ask for and I slept very well. We arrived early and the hotel let us into our room without us even asking. The staff were helpful and attentive. The hotel is based in a quieter area but only a few minutes walk will take you to some lovely sights. The rooms were clean and tidy. I found the beds to be one of the most comfortable I have slept in. All in all you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good rooms”
Reviews.Author: barteque
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in quiet area with a lack of shops and tapas bar, but you have to walk 15 minutes and you are on the Catalunia place. Breakfest are expensive, romms are very clean and good equipment. Every day you have few bottels of normal water and soda. There are rooms inside building which have no outside window only window to the main hall.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas market -La Fira Llucia”
Reviews.Author: Prifathro1953
Reviews.Content: A modern lobby gives quite a cold impression as you enter from the street, but the hotel is clean and comfortable and also very quiet. The food is very basic, although of good quality. In the evening,a cafeteria is available but no restaurant. Some simple meals are available, steak & chips, pasta & sauce, chicken breasts & rice etc. Breakfast was mostly cold, although some simple hot food eggs etc was available on request.Some staff were a little distant, but individuals were friendly. A 20 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya a little less to Segrada Familia. The hotel feels a little souless but it was good as a base to expolore central Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good location great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Conn_travel_lovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ayre on a Sat night , Nov 6th, Got in early with early flight from US, They let us in early and were extremely friendly and service oriented. Room was typical small European, modern design. Neighborhood was good,,, 15 min walk to Rambla and Old town. Near cental square and bus terminal. Didn't do metro but we were near metro stop. Took bus from airport and walked to hotel... maybe should have taken cab. Didn't have breakfast at hotel (seemed expensive) but found fantastic coffee shop 1/2 block away that was great. Real authentic, all neighborhood people having coffee after church,,, great pastries and coffee. We loved it and would highly recommend it. Went to great restaurant in Old town called Los Caracoles,,, another great local find . Another high recommendation We are experienced traveleres with high requirements,,, always want good value. This hotel fit our requirement and we would go again. Irene from Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, quiet, with all expected amenities”
Reviews.Author: gillesbourdier01
Reviews.Content: I was wary when it came to travelling to Barcelona, my first trip ever to Spain. But from the moment I stepped on Catalan soil at the airport, I realized I had it all wrong. Terminal one is simply the most beautiful, most convenient I have ever seen. Taxis are readily available and reliable. While I expected the worst, I must say that traffic laws are well obeyed and driving in Barcelona is relaxed. The city looks somewhat like a milder climate Zürich: lots of tree lined streets and avenues, ultra clean and green environment, efficient transit system. + architecture is mesmerizingly beautiful and the locals are rather friendly and easygoing. Hotel Ayre Caspe is perfectly in line with this description of the city. a nice modern, clean, quiet hotel with excellent service and a tasty breakfast buffet to boot. The seafront is a 25mn stroll from the hotel, and the nearest underground station (Arc de Triumf) is a leisurely 5 mn walk from the hotel. Be sure, however, that you embark on a TMB train, because there are also RENFE trains stopping there, offering fast transit through the city, but only stopping at some major stations. The Sagrada Family is only a short walk from the hotel, around 15/20mn. The area is safe and residential. I would definitely return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel gr8 location for Sagrada familia”
Reviews.Author: MAK786
Reviews.Content: Hi, booked this hotel after lots of research gr8 price for 3 nights at lastminute. Easy to find as barcelona is one of best cities. Walking distance indian restaurant mayura nice indian food bit expensive though. walking distance sagrada familia. rooms are gr8 spacious and excellent service jus one thing no english channels in rooms quite frustrating . rest of it was gr8 excellent for the price i got it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stang1sk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but kind of unremarkable. Clean room, good price, okay location. What really made the hotel great for us was that they let us check into our room at 7:30 am the day of our arrival. We had flown in from Canada and were tired and weary and expected to have to just store our luggage while we waited for our room. But the front desk clerk said the room was ready and we could check in despite the early time. This was very much appreciated. There wasn't a lot in the near vicinity of the hotel but it was only a 20 minute walk to La Rambla and the metro was nearby. Wireless internet was free but as we found in other hotels in Spain, it was unreliable. Fitness centre only had two or three cardio machines in a dark, little room and the sauna was out of order.

Reviews.Title: “Female solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: INID_BG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, quiet and clean. The location is not bad, however there are other hotels at a similar distance to the central part of Barcelona that you can find at a better price. I personally wasn't very happy with the walking distance to Las Ramblas or Passeig de Gracia which were not less than 20 min of intense walking away. There were not many homeless people in the area (which seems to be a problem for Barcelona), however I found out that you can see them just about everywhere, so it is inevitable to run into one. One guy was sleeping in the entrance of the bank just opposite the hotel... So here are the pros and cons: Pros: - Clean room, spacious and modern. - My room wasn't on the street, so it was pretty quiet, though you could clearly hear people talking in the corridors and doors opening and closing. No noise from neighboring rooms though. Cons: - Internet, which was free of charge, was very difficult to connect to. I had to move my laptop around in order to get online. In addition the connection was not fast enough, but I was let to believe that you don't get good internet in hotels in Barcelona anyway. - As already mentioned the distance to main shopping and entertainment areas is not as short as it seems on the map. Though 20-30 minutes walk can get you to Las Ramblas, Passeig de Gracia or La Sagrada Familia, remember that it can be very hot in Barcelona.You could of course use the public transport which is very convenient and reliable and there are bus stops nearby. If you prefer taxi, it's just better to book a room in one of the more central hotels as taxi rates seem to be very high in Barcelona (even for people like me coming from Scandinavia). - The staff, though polite was not very good when it comes to giving you the right directions. - You should be careful when checking out. There was a slight problem with my payment, they reserved the money on my credit card twice, though they tried to convince me that it was not the case. The hotel released the money after few days, however that created a problem for me. - My last objection is to the breakfast which was not included in the price and seems to be something you should avoid. But, for the price we are paying I believe one should get breakfast, no matter good or bad. To summarize, I would recommend the hotel to people that don't mind long walks and/or public transportation. I would stay there again, but only in case I am unable to find the same quality(and similar distance) hotel at a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: bjimenez12
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days while in Barcelona. Room was a little small, but it was very modern. Only complaint is that it was a little out of the way from the sights.... didn't really bother us much though!! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: exercisejunkey
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 5 blocks from the Rambles and 1 from the metro. In a quire street but with in 10 mins of centre. The room was a good size and with a shower over the bath and a walk in shower. You got free wi-fi in the room and free bottled water. The breakfast was good and the staff very helpful I would definately recommend it

Reviews.Title: “price / quality hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: deeBartman
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Internet (106 €/night - breakfast included) and had a very pleasant stay in February (2010). Staff was very fiendly and helpful. The hotel has a modern and trendy style and is located in a quiet neighbourhood, metro is two blocks away or you can walk to Placa Catalunya (10-15 minutes). Breakfastbuffet was very good. The only negative thing we experienced was the hardness of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: VickiWa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Sept 2010. Upon arrival had a choice of a room with an exterior window but two single beds, or a room with an interior window and a king sized bed. We chose the latter which proved to be quite a large room and the lack of a window wasn't a problem. Clean room, great bathroom and a very comfortable, albeit firm, bed. The soundproofing isn't up to much but we were so tired from all the walking we did/the heat that it didn't really matter. It takes almost 20 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas and the nearest metro station is about less than a 10 minute walk. Staff very helpful and the 4 members of reception staff we met were very helpful. We didn't use any of the hotel facilites. We made our return journey to the hotel/airport via the train and metro as we only had one medium sized case between us. If we'd had more luggage, we would have found it a nightmare so I don't necessarily recommend doing that.

Reviews.Title: “Good,Clean and Slient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cagan12
Reviews.Content: We had made our booking on internet and they welcome us polite, we have couple room and room was big but our window not looking to out side of the hotel. Bath was perfect it has 1 shower and 1 bathtub.Location is not perfect but good its 15 min far from Plaça de Catalunya by walking, but 3 mins away you can see the metro station. its 2 or 3 minits far to Plaça de Catalunya by metro. Infront of the hotel thare is a litle market. Wather is free at rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Daisy18902
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ayre Hotel with my family. This was our first time in Barcelona. We found the hotel to be a great value. The staff was helpful, courteous, and always available. The rooms are large (by European standards) and comfortable. The Metro is near by and top sites are a short ride away. The breakfast was excellent. Wifi connection was reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller_cg4jn
Reviews.Content: I must say I found some of the reviews for this hotel a little harsh, we found this hotel to tick all the boxes for a good value for money hotel. The rooms are large and provide everything that you need. The bathrooms are also large in comparison to many hotels we have stayed in. Whilst it's about a 15min walk into the centre of Barcelona it's also only a 15min walk to the Sagrada Familia. There were only a few times we relied on public transport as Barcelona is pretty much a flat city and so it was nice to stroll down the streets and really experience the city for what it is. However if you do want to catch the metro it's only a 5 min walk down the road. Overall the staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel clean and tidy and for those who want value for money I would recommend this hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Marta W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Ayre Hotel Caspe. Plus: safe box free of charge, every day botteled water in the fridge, adequate value for what we paid, quiet and friendly area, free wi-fi. Minus: no breakfast included, a bit far from city centre (20 min walk), very early cleaning routine, only two lifts which is not enough in the busy times (7 floors), poor fitness equipment and jacuzzi was out of service during our stay. We don't think downfalls should put you off as we would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet room with a magnificent view of la Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellerYYC
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel with trepidation. For several months all five of us had been unsuccessful in getting confirmation that we were actually booked in this hotel. However, our initial concerns were put aside as we were welcomed by a very gracious hotel clerk who spoke excellent English. My husband and I had requested a room looking out on la Sagrada Familia and also one that was very quiet. Our first room turned out to be a disappointment. It was so small you could not move around the bed without tripping over it. However, as requested it was quiet. Since we were staying in the hotel for seven days we asked if we could move to a larger room but with the same view. Despite being told that the hotel was very busy we were given an opportunity to check out three other rooms. All hotel rooms we saw were decorated in the same very spartan style. When we selected our room we found it to be very clean and extremely quiet and had a magnificent view of la Sagrada Familia. We had the hotel book us a day tour of a local winery and visit to Montserrat. We were assigned an excellent tour guide who also helped us find a wonderful country restaurant for lunch. Location of the hotel was perfect for catching the subway and for attending a conference located nearby. We had a large number of restaurants to choose from in the area. We enjoyed daily breakfast at the hotel. It consisted of a variety of hot and cold dishes with plenty of fresh fruit. Eggs were prepared for us in any style we requested. When we checked out of the hotel our request for a vehicle large enough to carry five individuals with successes was honored. Although the proficiency level of English amongst the staff varied, between our limited Spanish and their limited English (except for the first desk clerk we met who was very fluent in English) all of our requests were handled very efficiently. The desk clerks greeted us very warmly each time we journeyed out of the hotel and returned.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: JQKhitstheroad
Reviews.Content: I was a bit underwhelmed by this hotel. I was kept awake by a buzzing, humming machine, possibly a washing machine or elevator. There are no clocks in the room. The hotel is 8 blocks from the Placa Catalunya, a 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Little personality”
Reviews.Author: science_299
Reviews.Content: We were excited about the prospect of a 'modern' hotel but apart from the lobby area we were quite disappointed. The room was quite bland and lacking with cheap-looking beech effect furniture and so on. We had a minor panic when leaving for the bus in the morning as the times on the lifts were about 15 minutes out - not exactly modern! The staff were fairly nonchalant and ignored us for a few minutes before greeting us without as much as a smile. When we called them to ask for the wifi to be activated (as the hotel manual suggested) we were told fairly abruptly that it was already on. The bathroom was impressive and actually had two showers, but no shower gel was supplied so I had to wash with bubble bath! I also suspect the soundproofing is not great as we could hear toilets flushing in the rooms around us. Having said that, it was fine as a crash pad, impeccably clean and not too pricey (80 Euros). The free wifi was a massive bonus and the location is ideal if you are leaving on for Girona airport early in the morning. I wouldn't choose it for a long stay (it was a bit like camping in an Ikea catalogue) but if you have an early bus it's worth considering. I think the 'modernist' angle is over-egging the pudding somewhat though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, and Comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjb25
Reviews.Content: I would definitely return to this hotel! The modern design did not make me feel uncomfortable at all. I thought it was excellent. The rooms are large and clean. The elevators are large and modern. The whole hotel is superb. It is close to La Sagrada Familia for sightseeing, but a bit more of a hike to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff were lovely”
Reviews.Author: bhindocha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2009, and I was really impressed. The staff are terrific, particularly Marina (French girl who works there during the day) and Oriol (Spanish guy who's a big Barcelona fan- works nights). They give out free bottles of water to guests in the rooms, and if they have any available at reception, they can give you some there too. The pictures of the hotel are exactly accurate, of all rooms and the entire hotel. The place looks spectacular, is incredibly affordable, and the staff were phenominal!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: CaptainNemo_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Close enough but not too far away from the crazy rumbling near Catalunya/Ramblas. The best part is having a restaurant and bar at the hotel when you are completely knackered and just want to hang. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff is also helpful and service oriented. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: DeeNYC17
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a business hotel but it works for any kind of traveler. It’s in a great location, not in the middle of things but close enough to it where you don’t feel like it’s a schlep to get to anything. The closest metro is Tetuan but you’re also close to Arc de Triomf. The front desk is helpful and pleasant. The rooms are a good size with great closet space. The A/C was a bit tricky to manage but at least it worked. There is a great bakery two blocks away on Caspe and there’s also a supermarket across the street. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends. Tip: If your luggage is heavy, take the bus from the airport so you don’t have to worry about carrying it up the stairs. The escalators are scarce here. The Aerobus goes to Pl. Catalunya (30 min ride, 5 euros) and you can take bus #55 to the hotel. I think it’s the Tetuan stop. It’s a less than 10 minute bus ride from Pl. Cata.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MickyMartin
Reviews.Content: I have had to stay in Barcelona a few times at the Claris and The Omm. I couldn't get into either recently when I went to Barcelona at short notice and booked this place in a hurry. I was actually pretty impressed. The room was as good as some 5 star hotels. There was little Gym which seemed never to be busy with some running machines and rowing machine, and even his and her saunas. It is a bit out of the way maybe 10-15 mins to Placa Catalunya but not bad and there are 2 metro stations within two blocks. Get a Barcelona travel card from the machines at the metro- the instructions are in english and it takes credit cards. The rooms on the road side could be bit noisy if you have the window open and I recognised the complaints that others have made about the air conditioning which can make a very quiet odd noise like a milk float starting off but this is very faint and I think it is unlikley to keep anyone one of normal fortitude awake. The front desk were helpful and recommended a restaurant around the corner called the Yr Gauna al ribero which we thought was excellent for carnivores and had some nice wine ( nearly all red!). All in all I thought it was good value for £140 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: giftzwerg
Reviews.Content: Clean and Modern Hotel with modern Rooms. Rooms clean and tidy. Good size bathroom with shower and full bath. 4 mins walk from the Arc de Triomf metro station (metro exit Sortida Napols then straight up Carrer de Napols - Hotel on the right hand side where Napols crosses Carrer de Caspe). Only thing had problem with was getting to grips with the AirCon/Heating system I always managed to have it too hot or too cold. Tried to open windows but think they were sealed units. All in all Happy with the Hotel. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kmharris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great area - just a 10 minute walk from Passeig de Gracia in the Eixample district. Perfectly located for the metro with Arc de Triomf and Tetuan stations around the corner, and a short walking distance from the Sagrada Familia. The staff were helpful, and while the rooms were smallish, they were clean and stylish. The walls were a little thin, but many modern hotels suffer from this problem. Around the corner, (on either C/Napols or C/Sicilia) there is a Condis mercado, which is great for picking up bottles of water or snacks. I'd definitely stay here again for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, nice area.”
Reviews.Author: cls408
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Barcelona to sight see before traveling home after a holiday. The hotel is in a good location, 15 minute walk to La Rambla and a 20 minute walk to the Gaudi Cathedral. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Room facilities are very good, the room and hotel in general was very clean and tidy. Parking was good value and very convenient. Would and did recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: QueenanneYork
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Caspe for four nights and we were over the moon with our choice of accommodation. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful [we did have a problem with the safe but after a quick call to reception this was soon fixed]. The room was serviced daily and the fridge topped up with bottled water. The hotel is situated ith L'Eixample district about ten minutes stoll to Cataluyna Square. We found the walk to be no problem with many intersting buildings to admire along the way. The hotel is also only a ten minute walk to the Sagrada Familia. To sum up we found the hotel to be extremely good value [at around 60euros per room per night,] yes you can find hotels closer to main hub but at this price you can't argue for Barcelona in peak season!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & quiet but far from center”
Reviews.Author: couple30
Reviews.Content: We have been in the hotel for 3 nights (in a "summer dil"). the hotel is about 25-30 min walk from center, in a quiet and not very touristic neighborhood. rooms were cleaned every day, switch towels and u get free water. we didnt get breakfast because its high price. except from the distance from the center and the need to switch metros, the hotel was good, new and staff very nice (and rather handsome!) tip- ask for a room that the window is exterior...

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, a little dull”
Reviews.Author: Losviages
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ayre Hotel Caspe with my husband for two nights in August 2008. Having already spent about a week in BCN, we decided to further extend our stay, but our initial hotel didn't have any more vacancy and we had to change to this hotel instead. We chose it mainly because it offered a room at relatively low price, and seemed to be a modern and clean hotel. The hotel is located on a quiet side street of Gran Via and is bit far from everything, though still in the center. It was actually a little hard to find the hotel in the first place, because looking from the map, I had estimated it to be a lot closer to its nearest metro station 'Monumental'. Anyhow, the hotel is accessible by metro. There isn't anything badly wrong with the hotel or its rooms, but the overall feel is a little shabby, worn-out and IKEA-like and hence it most certainly isn't four star standard. The room minibar was filled with complimentary spring water, but so it is in most BCN hotels these days. I mean, with the same price, you can find better hotels with better location in BCN. However, if all other good hotels are fully booked and you get a nice offer, Ayre Hotel Caspe is an okay choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Fresh and Pleasant Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wolfhound86
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good stay at this hotel. The first impression is the very modern reception area. It was also always well presented, clean and cool. The area the hotel was located was very quiet, and is about 15 mins walk from las ramblas. If not mobile it is about 5 mins walk form metro station. You can go via the Barcelona Arc de Triomphe & gardens which is a lovely walk. The rooms also had a modern feel to it. They were clean but not the most spacious. As standard the room comes with safe for storing valuables, etc. Bathromm was clean and had a walk-in shower. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, they can book shows, trips on request. We stayed on a room only basis. Did not try the restaurant because it didn't look open at any time, was always empty so not a good sign, but could be wrong. But across the street from the hotel was a small supermarket which was great to stock up on drinks and food for lunch on the go. Also a larger supermarket around the corner. Hotel mentioned that it had a spa, but this was very small and segregated to male/female, not as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tattypie
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend (we are aged 19 and 22) stayed here for 5 nights in August. We were very impressed with the hotel - it was modern, comfortable, the staff were very helpful and it was very good value for money considering we didn't have breakfast included. The only irk about it is that it is about a mile's walk from the centre of the city (the Plaza), which we didn't mind at all, but if you have tired legs from walking around sightseeing all day it's not something to look forward to! The neighbourhood is quiet and safe, and a taxi into town or back to the hotel at night is cheap. The staff were lovely, but the bar was practically non-existant as it closes at about 7pm so after a nice meal you cannot come back to a glass of wine at the end of the night. I would reccommend this hotel but not for people who don't like walking.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor Service at the Ayre Hotel Caspe”
Reviews.Author: onebigyodel
Reviews.Content: There's something strange going on at this hotel. The maids don't clean the rooms (we came home one night at 8 p.m. to an unmade room after being gone since 10 a.m.), the wireless Internet doesn't work, and when you ask for service that is supposted to be automatic--like a fridge filled with free bottled water that replaced daily, they bring it to your door at 11.30 p.m., waking you up after you long gave up on it. Every day we returned to the hotel (we were there 4 nights), our key card no longer was functioning and we'd have to come back down and get a new one. It's too bad about all this poor service. Because the room was a decent size, fairly quiet (but far from the advertised "soundproof"), had A/C, a nice shower and tub, comfortable bed, but I have to say, I've had better service at one-star hotels and I'm not a high maintenance person--I would just think for 90 Euros a night that your room could at least be made up while you're out for the day. Anyhow, the location is ok, not stellar. It's a decent walk to most attractions and Barcelona is very sprawling. There are a couple of metro stops a few blocks away, nothing really close. But we had a great time in Barcelona anyway. We're not the type of travelers to go to a place and sit in the hotel. Thank goodness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overrall hotel”
Reviews.Author: heyfonzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent in every aspect. It was very modern and simplistic in design but also very clean. It is a short walk to the nearest metro which links to every within the city but if you are feeling adventurous you can walk to many of the main attractions e.g las rambles and sagrada familia which are only 5-10 minute walks away. I would definately recomend this hotel and would definately go back I loved this hotel and Barcelona is an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Jimpy99
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean and a decent size, with a large bath and shower area. It was really quiet too. The contemporary design is really appealing and it has all the facilities you need. The beds are pretty hard but that you will find almost everywhere. The staff, particularly the bar staff were friendly but we wouldn't recommend the restaurant for breakfast simply because there are cheaper alternatives a five minute walk away. Our fave place within the area was La Burgalerie on Carrer De Girona. Walk down Carrer de Casp towards the central area, Carrer de Girona cuts across. Turn right into it and it is on the corner of the block next to a main carriageway. It's good food, good value for money, the staff are great and there is an English version of the menu if you feel shaky with your Spanish. The central area is only 15 minutes or so walk but there is public transport nearby. We preferred the walk as this is such a beautiful city. We had no problems with this hotel whatsoever and it suited our long weekend stay perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice minimal hotel”
Reviews.Author: apanemo
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend in Barcelona and Ayre hotel was very nice in a very nice quiet area, and the staff was really helpfull. Was very clean, nice and cody. Very comfortble rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vpv23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in February 2008 for two nights. The staff was helpful and the room was very spacious. It is not terribly close to the center, but we walked from the center to the hotel with no problem. As long as you have a map of the city and a map of the metro, you're set to go anywhere. The staff is more than happy to guide you.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Ayre Hotel Caspe...”
Reviews.Author: Jaymo70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Caspe for three nights in early September. First impressions on entering the hotel were that this hotel had a modern contemporary look and feel to it, with bright, spacy areas and funky-looking furniture in the reception area. Staff were friendly and very helpful - on entering the room we found that the safe was not working and reported this immediately, at which point a member of staff was despatched straight away to our room to "fix" it. The room itself was nice and clean, and of a reasonable size with adequate furnishings and a decent bathroom. We had breakfast on the first morning, which was of a fairly good standard and of the usual hotel buffet variety, both hot and cold, but as is usual in hotels we felt the price was slightly too high and had breakfast elsewhere in cheaper cafes for the rest of our stay. The hotel is located in a fairly quiet street, with the nearest metro station about five minutes walk away. Placa Catalunya was about a twenty five minute walk away (ok, so we walk slowly but that's the best way to see a beautiful city like this!!), but there are a number of bars and restaurants nearby if you are feeling less energetic. Overall, I enjoyed this hotel. Good location, clean, decent room, friendly staff, reasonably priced and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona, Barcelona gorgeous Barcelona!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBuilder
Reviews.Content: Staying in Barcelona in August is very hot and crowded, but I guess that that is one of the attractions of the city: the constant bustle, noise, cosmopolitan attraction of the place is both exhilerating and exhausting. The Hotel Ayre Caspe, however, is situated away from the hurley burley of the city, yet within comfortable walking distance of two metro stations Tetuan and Arc de Triomf - both of which are within easy access of the main Ramblas district. The hotel itself is 4* and is very chic in its presentation. It is built round a great glass courtyard (a little reminiscent of the film The Matrix in a strange way). The staff were very courteous and accommodating (although our holiday was so problem free we only saw them at check in and check out). The room was the standard hotel room - the beds were hardish but I prefer them that way, the TV showed the Olympics, the curtains gave near blackout in the morning and the shower was excellent. Food is not included in the package and seems rather expensive if you do want to eat at the hotel. Every morning I made the 1 minute walk to the local cafe and had a cafe con leche and toast or croisant at a table outside watching the world go by - very cheap and very good service (Cafe Sol d'Or). Getting round Barcelona is so easy. best value is to buy a T10 at the ticket machine which entitles you or your party 10 trips. During our stay my wife and I had a ticket each (actually 3 as there is so much to see) and on the last day we bought one and passed it backwards and forwards across the ticket reading machine - the ticket is designed for this purpose. It also allows you on the fantastic bus service and the train from the airport to the tube station Sants Estacio. We bought a Bus Touristic pack from the hotel for 3 Euros per pack with the intention of going on one of the tours of the city. In the end we didn't but the money was recouped by presenting the tokens at all the sites (including some food places) and it saved us money in the end - probably about 10Euros each. Eating out was great but as Barcelona is a world city, not cheap. There are the usual MacDonalds etc but two restaurants we found were Agua on the beach near the Olympic village - gorgeous setting but you must book as it is so popular, and a little restaurant just off Las Ramblas - Sinatras lovely food and great service. One night we went for a meal at Taberna Barca on the Ramblas - avoid at all costs the wine cost 21 Euros for house wine and the chicken was wings with more gristle and skin than meat! On our last day we went to Fresc Co - all you can eat for 9.95. It reminded me of a school canteen: noisy, crowded, lots of tasteless carbohydrates (no meat that I could see) Pizza pieces (actually the only part that I enjoyed) but hey-ho each to his own and it filled my stomach ready for the flight back home. If you want some culture in the evenings - theatre, opera, concerts - choose any months other than July and August as all the theatres close for the summer. Barcelona is a wonderful city filled with unforgettable experiences especially the architecture of Gaudi - see it and die!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveler48
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, modern, well-outfitted hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. It is near the Sacred Family church and within walking distance of the Gothic Quarter. The hotel rooms are spacious and well-air conditioned. Highly recommended for pre and post cruise accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, too far from the Ramblas, No Wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Sukki007
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, check in was easy. We arrived quite early from our cruise ship and took a cab to the hotel, which seemed to be in the middle of nowhere. The lobby was very large, modern and sparsely furnished - no warmth at all, and I don't mean the temperature. Check-in was a breeze. I had anticipated problems because of the early hour of our arrival, but there were none. We were given a room immediately. The room was spacious by European standards, and clean. But the bed was hard, and when I asked if they could do anything to help, such as an eggcrate topper, I was brusquely told "no." One of the reasons for choosing this hotel was price, which was lower due to the location. The other was that it offered free in-room Wi-fi. This was a necessity, since my husband absolutely had to do some work. We were dismayed to find that it never worked during both nights of our stay, not in the room and not in the lobby. The people at the desk weren't apologetic, and just plain didn't care. We were happy to see that there was an internet cafe right across the street, but when my husband went there, he couldn't believe that it was Chinese - ALL Chinese: management, customers, and keyboards! On our long walk toward the Ramblas we found two more internet cafes, but they, too, were strictly Chinese. We were in Barcelona two years ago and had no trouble finding one, but apparently immigration has been ramped up! We finally found one that he could use, but it was just to send an email to his boss explaining why he couldn't do what he was supposed to be doing. He needed his own computer to connect to the U.S. government's secure website. On our second day we left our room at 10:00 a.m. and didn't return until late in the evening. We found that our room had not been cleaned AT ALL! I went downstairs to the desk and was met with the same lack of concern and again, no apology. The guy simply handed us a couple of clean towels. We had not paid for the room in advance, just booked online with a 35 Euro deposit with the booking service the hotel uses. The next morning at checkout we asked for a reduction on our bill due to the necessary wi-fi not being provided and our room not being cleaned. No way, Jose. They would not budge, and offered nothing as compensation. We refused to sign the charge slip, but they had the info and we have just gotten the bill with the full amount charged. We are now disputing the charge. Yes, certainly we should pay for the two nights we stayed, but I believe that we are owed something for all the trips down to the desk to deal with the wi-fi issue, plus the lack of maid service. Sure it's a foreign country and wouldn't have ended this way in the U.S., but Spain's a modern country and this is inexcusable. About the neighborhood: I read so many reviews about the Ayre Caspe on Trip Advisor and there was much written about the neighborhood - some people saying it was dicey and others reporting that they felt safe. While we didn't like the location due to its distance from the main Plaza, the Ramblas, and other sites in the city, there is absolutely no reason to fear it. It's a residential neighborhood, lots of apartment houses, not unpleasant to look at, and completely safe. We walked it day and night, and even walked back at 1:00 a.m. from the Ramblas, a long trek. The streets weren't full of people, but there were no muggers or suspicious-looking characters, either. Fear of the neighborhood shouldn't stop you from staying here. But the sterile atmosphere, cold and indifferent management, and lousy service should make you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sx7
Reviews.Content: Read quite a few reviews on this hotel (and others in barcelona) The price clinched it in the end (106 Euros a night) which seemed reasonable for barcelona The room had a nice modern style and was certainly one of the better rooms I have stayed in. A nice touch was a bath and separate shower in the bathroom. There was free use of the safe and the aircon was permanently available (Some go off when you take the room card out). The rooms are well insulated from the outside, but not so well insulated between the rooms so I could hear the people in the next room. In fairness though every hotel I have ever stayed in I have heard noise from the next room. The staff were really helpful with one of them taking us down in the lift to show us where the jacuzzi and gym were. We arrived just after midday and they let us check in straight away. The tube stations were only a short walk, the arc de triomph is the main station near the hotel although the Tetuan is slightly closer. We used the aerobus from BCN airport, got off at PL. Catalunya then took the metro to Arc de triomph. There is 3 exits, the nearest exit is just opposite the NORD train station. I was a little unsure about Barcelona as I read about the muggings, but I felt quite safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms, service”
Reviews.Author: HappyPotters
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights and had a lovely time.The Hotel is in an excellent location about 10-15mins walk to all the attractions La Ramblas etc. Room was excellent and spotlessly clean. Reception staff were very helpful and courteous. Found a nice local drinkery just around the corner from the Hotel and an excellent "Mexican" Restaurant within walking distance. Will almost certainly be going to Barcelona again the near future and would stay at the Ayre Caspe. PS The only small downside to the Hotel is that the Jacuzzi is freezing!! Would definitely reccomend the Hotel to friends and thank you to the Ayre Caspe for a lovely break.

Reviews.Title: “Really - Can Not Recommend This Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happylifeAnna
Reviews.Content: I have been stolen my handbag at the bar of this hotel and I have NEVER ever seen such a lousy service, such a missing support by the staff like in this hotel. I have been travelling all over the world and still stay in different hotels on business-trips, but I have never seen something like this. There was not even an excuse by the staff, no support of delivering me the right phone number to cancel my mastercard. I gave the number of Mastercard to the staff at the reception the day I left, although I do hope that this doesn't happen to any guest again. I had and stil have a hard time to get all my documents, money back. That's why I am writing this complaint. - There was no offer of anything or help of the hotel and again, as I can just repeat not even an excuse....- Unbelievable! They have security people and a camera in the hotel, but they seemed so uninteressed and it seems that several thefts have tried to get into the hotel, as I have been told by one of the security person. But the hotel didn't even show the film, which showed exactly how the theft happened, to all of the security staff. - Again, I have never seen such a bad service and as for your own security, I CAN'T RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK... definitely not a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Carlos-Gh
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ayre after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and arrived there for a 4-night stay with rather high expectations. The first disappointment came with the location of the hotel : it's not that close to a metro station (15 min. walk to Arc de Triumf) and quite far from any major tourist attraction (Closest would be the Familia Sagrada at 30 min. walk). There's nothing really of interest in the neighborhood and I'm still wondering why they chose that place to build a hotel as it suits neither a business trip need or a holiday break expectation... The staff is polite and speak several foreign languages (English, French...). Rooms are large and clean, but the overall hotel interior "design" reminds me more of an Ikea showroom : the furniture is actually made of cheap materials and feels cold. We had a room on the street side : it was quite noisy at night. I've stayed in seveal 4 / 5 stars hotel, and the Ayre should be classified as a 3-stars. Breakfast is just OK, although I'd also recommend to go for one of the coffe shops nearby. Not actually a bad place, but there are many other better places to stay in Barcelona whether you're there for business or for a vacation. This hotel is probably overrated on tripadvisor, check for other reviews/hotels as a stay in Barcelona deserves an accomodation as exciting as the city can be!

Reviews.Title: “No ambience”
Reviews.Author: baregan
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Very close to the main bus terminal, good for those coming from Girona airport. Also near 2 metro stops. Hotel is very clean to the point of feeling clinical. Nice room and very good shower in bathroom. Cons: Staff are not very helpful with tourist advice. Resturaunt is terrible, portions are tiny and expensive.Avoid! Zero atmosphere in the hotel, suited for older travellers.

Reviews.Title: “It was so so.”
Reviews.Author: bbbboooooooyah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at Ayre Hotel. Nothing to complain about. The room and bathroom were roomy and clean. The lobby, elevator and hallways seemed like you're at a clinic but who cares, you're not going to hang out there. We had trouble using the safe the first day so we called front desk and someone came up right away to fix it. Free internet in the room, so bring your laptop. The location is residential but only 5 mins walk to the metro and 15 mins walk to La Sagrada Familia. If I had to do it all over again, I would probably pick a hotel around Las Ramblas or the Gothic area, we kept going back there for the restaurants and bars! So, make sure you get a Barcelona Card for unlimited metro/bus rides and free entry or discounts to selected museums.

Reviews.Title: “was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: laobhaise
Reviews.Content: I found the Ayre Hotel Caspe lovely. It's quite, modern and clean and not too expensive (room was 340 for 3 nights, booked from hotel website). The area is lovely, it's a residential area so not at all touristy or tacky and its only 15 walk into placa catlunya or 5 mins walk to metro stop of either arch triomphe or tetuan(with choice of more lines). I would mention on check-in that you want a double bed (i read on tripadvisor that they give two single beds pushed together otherwise). I would also say you would like one facing the street as the rooms are bigger. We had an room facing the internal courtyard and although the bed was huge the room itself was quite small and so was stuffy. The bathroom was nice and big with a huge walk-in shower as well as bath. Towels and bed was attended to everyday and the bed was really comfy! The tv has channels from Spain,France,Germany and Italy and Uk (it's sky news but at least it's something). We didnt have breakfast included (its about €15 a head for continental...). Instead there is a fab cafe with bakery around the corner from the hotel. (go out foyer, turn right and take first left -it's across the road, they do huge fresh croissants and rolls for a few €. The staff were lovely except for one man who was possible the rudest person I have ever met. Besides him, they were extremely friendly and helpful in everyway. The jazzi and steam room is in each changing room in the basement so it isn't very pretty (feels a bit sterile) but was nice and clean (though the water was a bit cold). There is also a small gym. I did find the hotel very hot. I think I read the temperate in the landing at 28 C and our room was so stuffy at night we had to turn on the aircon with isnt very healthy... Another negative is the door to the bathroom isn't sealed as it's a sliding lateral door... however, overall i would stay here again and would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest and shouldnt be a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: newlywed75
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through laterooms at 85 Eur per night and although its advertised as a four star we were not impressed. The location is good with about 2 minutes walk to the Metro station and its located in one of the business areas. We used the Metro to get around Barcelona and found it fantastic and used it as late at 1130pm. The reception area is impressive when you enter and looks very new and modern. We were situated on the top floor and although the room wasnt very big is was modern and clean. The downside was that they advertise soundproof walls and even if someone coughs in the hallway it sounds as though they are in your room as it does when someone showers in the room next to you. This isnt so bad if you get up before 7am however otherwise you will be woken up with the noise. The temperature in the room was boiling, and this was in january when it was only 17 degrees outside in the day and around 5 at night. We turned the air con onto full power at the coolest possible and it was still warm although manageable. This was made worase by the fact the every night they switched the power off so no air con, no lights etc at about 1am. The last awful part was the bar, but only was it quiet most nights. The night we went for a drink at 10pm when 3 other guests were there drinking, including one being served when we arrived and the close hours being 11pm we were refused a drink as they said they were closed. We were not drunk as my husband had had 2 glasses of wine and me being pregnant I'd had none and only wanted a fanta or lemonade before going to bed. We found this very rude. Overall Id say stay somewhere else preferably in the area La Ribera which is in the gothic area of the city and very smart if we visited Barcelona again and Im not usually fussy but i have to say I've stayed in more pleasant 3 star hotels elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Prettypollycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ayre Hotel Caspe in Barcelona for 3 nights on a room-only basis. We did not eat in the hotel at all, only because we had breakfast in a little cafe and then lunch and dinner outside. The hotel foyer is very modern and minimalist with funky chairs and a small pool with lights floating in it. The room we had was also modern with pale wood fittings and floor. It was well appointed with lots of wardrobe space behind Perspex sliding doors and an extensive desk area. There was a safe in the room and a fridge with complimentary water replenished every day. The bathroom was modern with a powerful shower and separate bath also with shower over. Shower gel, shampoo, comb, toothbrushes, shower cap and sewing kit were supplied. We arrived at 11:30am but were allowed to check-in immediately which was great. We found the staff very pleasant. It was about a 15 minute walk up to La Sagrada Familia and about 20 minutes to La Rambla. The nearest metro is Arc de Triomf and it’s just a 5 minute walk to the bus station where the Barcelona Bus from Girona Airport (RyanAir) stops. This hotel may be a little out of the way for people who want to be very close to La Rambla but we would most definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bookishbabe
Reviews.Content: We just spent a very comfortable four nights at the Ayre Hotel Caspe. After several cramped, loud rooms throughout Europe, it was wonderful to have a good-sized, clean, well-furnished, comfortable and quiet room. Yes, the lobby is ultra-modern and a bit clinical, but we care much more about the room. After a long day of sight-seeing, I want a good bed, a well-laid-out space, and a quality shower, all of which this hotel offers. We appreciated the free bottled water and the mini-refrigerator, in which we stored lunch supplies. The location was fine for us -- a quiet street with several grocery stores and cafes nearby, and very close to the Arc de Triumpf subway station -- maybe 5 or 10 minutes walk. Regarding the subway: I have to disagree with the comment above. Yes, the stairs and long halls are a pain, but the system is extensive, and I've never seen a subway system that was so well marked and easy to use. Every station entry has staff available to answer questions or provide other assistance. We were able to quickly travel all over Barcelona using this excellent system.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiburonTony
Reviews.Content: As a number of other reviewers have commented this is a very modern style hotel. The lobby area feels a little cold and was generally devoid of guests. The bedrooms are excellent with ample room, substantial closet space and expansive work desk with free broadband Internet acess. As noted by others the bathroom was well fitted with a walk-in shower plus a tub with full shower; excellent water pressure and hot water. The front-desk staff were excellent, on check-in they didn't have my reservation (made directly on their Web site) but it took two minutes and everything was fine. We had planned on staying a total of six nights but after the first night we had to return home due to sickness, the desk agent was extremely solicitous and handled our check-out with no fuss or muss. The bar and restaurant are small and appear almost an afterthought, and the night we were there poorly patronized. We were the only people in the dining room the whole evening. The food while not particularly adventurous was good and not unreasonably priced (the breakfast at Euro14 seemed high and so we intended skipping that). With the outstanding bedroom facilities but limited bar/restaurant It struck me as more of a business hotel than a tourist hotel; I'd be curious as to the original demographic target. We thought the location was pretty good, a little of the main track but a 15 to 20 minute walk to Plaça de Catalunya and the start of La Rambla or a five minute walk to Arc de Triomf and the Metro stop. Slightly tangential but my advice is to not take the train from the airport and then Metro, but take the Aeroporta express but to Plaça de Catalunya and then either walk or take a taxi to the hotel. Barcelona's Metro is the most unfriendly system I have encountered in a long time. To get from Barcelona-Sants Train Station to Arc de Triomf by Metro is a nightmare, endless stairs up and down (which with luggage is hard work), no escalator (actually just one), endless walks through subterranean tunnels and poor signage. There is supposedly a city train connecting Barcelona-Sants and Arc de Triomf but we couldn't find it and no one we asked was able to help; we must have phrased the question poorly I think. Overall I would rate the hotel exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern with a slightly clinical feel and quite far from the action.”
Reviews.Author: janemcnally
Reviews.Content: WE have just returned from a short three night break in Barcelona and stayed at the hotel Caspe. The hotel is decked out in ultra modern chrome and glass style, unoffensive rooms and leisure areas although we found the decor overall to be quite clinical and lacking in any kind of ambience........(this was not a huge problem though as we packed a lot into our trip and spent very little time hanging out in the hotel.) Our room was airy and comfortable (the bed extremely so!) and we managed an excellent peaceful nights kip each night. Also, the walk in shower and seperate bath was good. Having read the other reviews I did not find the staff to be unfriendly or rude but at the same time they did not fall over themselves !........(athough the barman was very chatty and helpful.) Location wise, this was not ideal, whilst not far from the Sagrada Familia, central Barcelona and the Ramblas was a good twenty to twenty five minute walk although there are regular buses and the metrolink is close by. Overall we had a pleasant stay and plan to return to Barcelona again but probably not to this hotel. One final thing........if you are a live music fan check out Harlem Jazz Club (Carrer de la Contessa de Sobradiel 8.....just off la Ramblas) they have live music every night (We saw a fantastic Cuban band)..... the place gets jammed so arrive early!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: traveller3530
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a short stay at the Arye hotel, i went by the reviews on the trip advisor, while mostly i do rely on, and they have always been spot on, this time it was a bit disappointing.
