Firstly as we entered the hotel to check in we found one of the most unfriendliest staff we have ever encountered in the reception area. We enquired about the places to visit , they gave us a map, and asked to explore it.. then the price that they were charging us a bit higer then what i booked, but that was sorted out quickly. we have stayed in many 4 stars around the world but the service here was worst then 1 star. we went for a coffee at the Hotel 1898, and the reception there was extremely helpful(Even though we were not staying there), and that too is a 4 star hotel. The rooms were fine, bathroom was also good, the location not so great, i am sure there would be better options for the price we paid. even while checkout the reception staff was unfriendly, while they were attending to us . all of a sudden 2 people in the reception left us halfway to attend another guest, i mean this is basics. and not 4 star standard at all. all in all a experience i would like to forget.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: jerrykerry15
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Ayre Hotel Caspe on Calle Casp is really something. I had a fantastic stay in the middle of Barcellona. Location is great bacause you are far from the traffic and noises but at the same time about 15 min walking from plaza cataluna and La Rambla. 4 free bottle of water free every day. Great porter and bar service. Very good breakfast. What else to say? Thank you very much we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel with amenities befitting a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: bertrande80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights, together with 2 other friends who occupied another room. The hotel design is avant garde and very modern, which will not suit everybody but we liked it. The room furnishings were of a minimalist style but were all of a high quality. The bed was nice and comfortable and I liked the fact that the room was not carpeted but done up in parquet / faux parquet. Bathroom was large and the bath and shower areas were separate from each other. Toiletries provided were more than adequate and their soap in particular was a very interesting translucent yellow (frivolous but it just shows the hotel's attention to detail to ensure that the entire package was consistent). We found it difficult to work the air conditioning on the first night but a call to reception solved our problem. Like most hotels in Barcelona, breakfast was only provided at an additional cost of EUR14 per person per night. We decided not to take it. We really liked the location of the hotel because of its proximity to the Estacio del Nord, which is where the Barcelona Bus arrives from and departs to Girona Airport. If you are arriving in Barcelona via Ryanair and are arriving or departing in the wee hours of the morning, this hotel is ideal. In this respect, the lobby has comfortable seats for passing time (as we had to, given we had to catch the 3am bus to Girona). It may not be in the city centre but, as a previous reviewer has mentioned, the metro is very close by and Barcelona is not difficult to walk around, in any case. We walked to the Sagrada Familia very easily, for example. Overall, we would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SandraCampos
Reviews.Content: this is a good new hotel, with a modern design and confortable rooms. the staff is frendlily and it's a very nice choice for his price. the location is not so good, and will need to walk 15 or 20 minutes to go to the principal atracticons, but there is a tube station just two blocs from the hotel or you can take a taxi and paid around 5 euros to go to the ramblas, for example.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie37
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for almost a week. It is well located in a quiet neighbourhood 10 blocks from Paseig de Gracia. It may sound far, but there are 2 metro stations very close (2 blocks) from the hotel and a bus central station for intercity connections. The room was very modern, clean, well decorated, with proof sound windows. The bathroom was very good and confortable. The hotel was very quiet indeed and we could sleep really well. The only disadvantage was the breakfast, which was not included and it costs 15 euros. But just 1 block away, toward Arc de Triumph metro station there is a very popular and crowded bakery where you can eat your breakfast. The price was fair and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A little hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Pole
Reviews.Content: Very good accomodation in Barcelona, close enough to the main points of interest(15 min walk from Plaza Cataluna , 25 from Barceloneta, 10 from Sagrada Familia) and 5 min from the Metro line. Situated in a very quiet street, the facade is nothing to be remembered but don't be mislead, the best is waiting for you inside. We were a group of ten and got a very professional and fast reception, they were waiting for us and gave us ours five rooms in a minute, this is exactly what you want after a long trip. In general we found the personnell to be quite friendly and always ready to help us to choose a restaurant or call a taxi. Rooms clean, modern and superbly furnished, bath rooms like a five star hotel. Only negative note, some rooms do not have a window open to the outside but open to the interior of the hotel, so you cannot have a lot of privacy unless you keep the courtains always close, personally i didn't mind it but to someone the very simple idea of not being able to get a breath of fresh air from outside could make of it a bit suffocating experience. By the way, for a sort of compensation, these rooms are quite larger than the ones with the window open to the outside. The hotel is very new and designed in a modern and elegant fashion that may not appeal to someone (the colours of the interior like hall and corridors, meeting rooms and restaurant, are very ...cold: mainly white, grey and black , with a lot of steel and glass and alluminium, like a large office) the opposite of the traditional old Hotels that are always in red, orange and the warm colours of wood, but don't worry as you enter in you room you'll find everything elegant and at the same time warm and very very confortable. Having breakfast at the Caspe Ayre is a kind of experience you will be very happy and eager to repeat every morning: fresh good smelling coffee,fresh fruits, eggs and bacon well shown and properly done, a huge variety of breads and pastries, cold meats like salami and ham and , if you haven't drank enough the nigth before, even a glass of champagne to give the day a sparkling start.... the only oddity was the selection of food in the weekend differing sligthly from that of working days; if this sound strange it will sound even stranger that on weekends the restaurant is closed (at least it was when I was there), well any country has its own peculiarities and you have better to check in advance. In a few words this is an excellent little hotel, quiet and clean, modern and well supplied, worth any single euro or dollar you have paid for it, if I will be in Barcelona again I will definitely consider this as my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Angie24B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a total of 4 nights during two separate stays at the Ayre Caspe as it is actually called. I found it good value both times. The rooms are rather small, but perfectly clean and fresh. Bedlinen and towels were crisp and nice and the general areas (lobby, lobby bar, business center) all good standard. The location of the hotel is perhaps the drawback - walking to the Born area is a brisk 15 minutes, Barri Gotic another 10. Perfectly doable but still you are a little bit away from the action. I ended up walking down to Barri Gotic/Rambla several times, then taking a taxi back. The taxi fare from Placa Catalunya was around 4 euros - quite justifiable. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel since 14 euros seemed a bit heavy. However be aware that there aren't really any cafés/bars/restaurant close either. One good tip would be walking down to the Arc de Triomph and then following Carrer Commerc down to the area next to the Mercat de Born or around the Santa Maria del Mar - lots of nice cafés in that area. All in all a pleasant experience that came with a nice price tag with no other drawbacks than the location.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saral
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgious modern hotel, situated 3 blocks from Arc de Triomphe Metro station (5 mins walk), also the long distance buses come in here as well having a 'Communter' Train station there as well. It was 15 mins walk with a case on wheels from the Placa Catalunya, where the Aeroport Bus stops, we decided to walk from here to the hotel as there was quite a few steps to tackle with the cases to get the Metro the 2 stops. The outside of the hotel is a bit bleak, but inside.....it is lovely, the lobby is all marble and stainless steel with a water feature, up above is a modern art lighting installation, very impressive. There were 2 groups of chairs to lounge in. Check-in was efficient, they offered to take our bags to the room, but there is no need. The room was exactly like the pictures on the Internet, and spotlessly clean. There were 4 bottles of water in the Mini-bar, which the front desk informed us were free, and they were, the ones we used were replaced each day. We had a twin room at the back of the hotel, which was very quiet, there was a good size wardrobe and enough draws for everything, there was also a room safe, which mentioned you were covered for items up to 1500 Euros for items in the safe. There was a long table, 2 chairs and a double soft seat to sit. The TV didn't have any English speaking channels. The bathroom was a good size, with a bath/shower and a separate shower unit, WC, basin with enough area round about to spread things out! The room is all wood floors and stainless steel down to the skirting boards! There is a gym I believe but didn't use it or the Bar. Breakfast was 14Euros, as I can't eat 14E of breakfast in the morning so we went to the bakery Oriole which is in Carrer Napols, out of the hotel turn right and at the junction cross the road, to your left, it is on the opposide of the road, just further down, it is open everyday, they do lovely pastries and coffee for breakfast, just down the street is a fruit shop and on either side of the road are 2 supermarkets, carry on down this road and you will reach the Arc De Triomphe Metro station. When you return back on the Metro if you have come from the direction of Placa Catalunya, exit from the Metro carriage to the right and folow the signs for Carrer Napols for the nearest exit to the Hotel (the one where you started from). If you want a modern hotel in Barcelona this is a great example. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Gobot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is four blocks away from the sub station, but it's a great neibourhood, quiet and secur. The street were the hotel is situated is also quiet so it's easy to sleep. Nice room, not too small for Europe. A shower and a bath, very modern as the room itself. We had canadian exceptation for the quality and it turn out great. The staff is ok, speaks english, helped us with our luggage (we had them delivered a day after our arrival). There's two small grocery a block away, a drugstore, a place were you can call very easily anywhere in the wold for few euros. The hotel is near the Triumph Arch and Ciutadella park. Very nice to visit. We would recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: rms_traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are beautiful. Exactly like the hotel's website shows. The bathroom actually has two showers - one over the tub and a separate one. Everything was perfectly clean and crisp. Now for the bad - the front desk has a couple of guys really not interested in helping and were somewhat rude. I think they are more set-up for dealing with businessmen and not tourists. Also, the location is not ideal - a far walk to Sagrada Familia, a 3.5 block walk to the metro and not walking distance to much else. Next time I think we'll stay closer to the action. Don't bother with the hotel restaurant - it was terrible. Bland food and there's so much else out there. Their business center is under construction, so no internet access at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JJSET
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 25 euro taxi ride from the airport. It is on the road that runs parallel with the Gran Via mid way between the Ramblas and the Sagarda Familia. The exterior of the hotel doesn’t do the interior justice. It is a very modern hotel well positioned particularly if you intend to walk or use the tube to get around Barcelona. The staff were first class, we were booked in promptly and the porter was a mine of information. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. We had breakfast once and found it expensive at 14 euros. We have no hesitation in recommending the hotel particularly for those who wish to see the city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: jaxon41
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel, but found the service a wee bit crisp. The location was very good, mid way between Placa Catalunya and Sagrada Familia. An easy walk to each. The price was reasonable. FInding a place for breakfast in the area was difficult, but I didn't think there was an overabundance of breakfast restaurants anywhere in Barcelona -- at least nothing that serves what Americans eat for breakfast. Great water pressure, clean, nicely appointed rooms with soothing blond woods, and the ubiquitous Swedish modern type furnishings. Quiet, neighborhood area which we walked after dark without feeling anxious.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Barca Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suffolkholidayperson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days this Autumn. The hotel is superb. It is ultra modern in style with large clean rooms and public areas that are very smart. The staff were polite and helpful. We did not eat in the Fiesta but chose to sample local restaurants instead although we understand the Fiesta is very good for food. Try the cafe across the road for coffee and croissant at 1.65 Euros, or the cafe just up the road where an English breakfast inc juice and coffee is 6 Euros! The location is in a safe business area and there are plenty of shops and cafes nearby. The Fiesta is a good healthy walk from the centre of the city but not far from Sagrada Familia. Barcelona is an oustanding city and this October the weather was warm and pleasant. Shorts and sandals weather. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: cmonaussie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy 5 - 10 minute walk from the bus depot which services Girona Airport. There is no other public transport from Girona (taxi 150 euro!) so coach at 12 euro was perfect. A new, very modern hotel. Very helpful, polite staff. Lovely large room with all mod cons. Large fluffy towels. Breakfast is an extra 14 euro, but superb buffet, or you can order cooked breakfast as well. Well worth the price. We are tourists, but this hotel would also be great for business travellers. We couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: aBarc
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Location excellent value for money we stayed for 5 nights with Breakfast included. The buffet Breakfast had a great selection and they served until 11am at the week-end which was an added bonus. The facilities were good i.e. Sauna and Jacussi. Stayed in the Bar one evening and had coctails which was nice and relaxed. 15 minutes walk to Las Rambles and to the Beach. Will be going to Barcelona again next year and will stay here

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but can do better”
Reviews.Author: fran15111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently. Hotel style is modern and they have tried to have a cool concept in design and furniture. About 15minutes walk to Las Ramblas in a very quiet residential area. Overall at 79 euros for a double not bad value but the cleaning of the rooms was average we had to call and ask for soap everyday because when they cleaned the room they didnt replace any. Also rang and asked for an iron and ironing board and was told they didnt have any and that I would have to pay 5 euros for each shirt I wanted ironed and it would take 24 hours. Overall this hotel was not bad value for money but it certainll lacked something for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find!”
Reviews.Author: mikey393
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night business trip to Barcelona. What a fantastic City! The hotel which I found via your site was excellent, nice room, good facilities, air con too efficient! Nice helpful staff & above all nice a quiet & relaxed. Not too far from the main centre of things, Metro station Arc de Triomphe - 5 minutes walk away - 2 stops Place de Catalunya - Las Ramblas etc; I would certainly recommend for either business or wk/end break.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: Grahamofherts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Caspe for 2 nights in April. First time in Barcelona and have to say that the Caspe was top class considering the price. Rooms were spotlessly clean and well appointed. Did not use the restaurant so cannot comment on this. The Hotel is not central to the major touristy bits but is only a 20 mins or so walk from either the Marina area or Ramblas. If you do not fancy walking the underground is easy to get to and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's vacation in Barcelona. There were 4 of us and we had 2 rooms on the 5th floor of the Caspe. We will be recommending this hotel to our friends as at least one other couple will be travelling to Barcelona in the near future. The beds were comfortable and while the rooms were small they were nicely appointed with ample cupboard space and a handy nook in between the head of the bed and the window for storing empty suitcases and golf clubs. Also appreciated the room safe for our valuables. (Golf courses are way out of town. If you really want to golf perhaps stay out in the country somewhere.) While the hotel was indeed 9 blocks from the Placa Catalunya we bought the 10 ride metro pass and walked the 3 blocks down C. de Naples to the Arc de Triomf Metro just about every day. On the way to the metro we often stopped at the Oriol Bakery, about half a block from the hotel on Naples for breakfast when we didn't feel like the large breakfast buffet that was available at the hotel. We occasionally took cabs at the end of the day when we had worn out our feet and usually the cab drivers knew the hotel. When they didn't "the corner of Napols and Casp" was all they needed to know to get us home. Barcelona is such a lovely city and with things to see on every block of every avenue and every side street in the city center you will not be bored. You will cover miles without realizing it. We can recommend the Italian restaurant on the Placa de Tetuan (sorry, I neglected to write down the name but it is at about the 8 o'clock position of that round-about if 12 is at the north) and Ququ which is just north of Casp on Gracia. Also quite enjoyed Gino's on Via Laietana just south of Fontanella and the 7 Portes and Los Caracoles. Final note, beware of pickpockets. I had left my purse unzipped and had a very close encounter as I came out of the Arc de Triomphe metro but apparently they are everywhere. Because of pick-pockets I left my passport in the room safe but a photocopy of the front page in your purse would be good for Tax Back info or in case you are stopped by the police. Apparently that happens sometimes in Spain although it never happened to us. Karen

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: JHCumming
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Barcelona and we weren't sure what to expect from the hotel, as it was at least my first time of booking my holiday completely from the Internet. On arrival the atmosphere was very friendly and professional from the receptionists, and I didn't sense the smell of mildew at all(as one reviewer pointed out). Our room was on the top floor and was sparkling clean with all mod cons, as shown in a previous reviewers pictures. There was no problem with noise from the street below and on the third night of our stay we slept soundly through a major storm! We did not pay for the breakfast, thinking 14 euros was a little expensive(and not within our budget!) and so instead went to the little supermarkets and cafes within the area. I did not feel that far away from the centre of Barcelona, as other reviewers have commented and felt that the area was quiet at night but not unsafe. I really enjoyed my stay at the Fiesta Caspe, and was surprised it was so cheap for (what was advertised as) a four star hotel.
